TEqEk1wqAomvj2Ct8YTBhw.text: I have now been here twice. One for lunch/regular menu - so many food options! and once for brunch - so many food options!   Both times my service and food were exceptional. Will definitely be returning to test out the happy hour waters. :)

urjulNDUFA6MRymZQjs0sA.text: This spot has great specials a great happy hour and great service. 3 musts means you should experience dive yourself.

h9qwGj2x4RiMHSZlfENYiQ.text: Mediocre food and an unfriendly bartender that doesnt get what a return customer is..a real yinzer meathead

5CdSpu2AOdVZhn8rVxUXPg.text: This place is amazing!! The food is great and the restaurant is classy.. different than I expected. Also Dillan was our server, and he was awesome!! Super attentive and quick great service. We'll be back!

KPPMcORNfZsOl1X49v9tJA.text: Cheap prices, great food. Win win. Decent size portions and friendly staff. Definitely coming back!

zEPtnpbsxV83ganM1FTYqw.text: Dropped in for brunch yesterday before the Steelers game and loved the place. The food and service were excellent. I had the Chicken and Funnel Cake with a Bloody Mary on side - highly recommend!!!

67d1qSqcRkJoKdTbsILjzw.text: Had the calamari and it was amazing!! Really nice place would definitely come back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

a44EL1jw1bN6y4Vc4z54eg.text: The environment was very welcoming and there was good music throughout our visit. We ordered the potato croquets as an appetizer and they were delicious. They were the best part of the meal. It took the staff 10 minutes to greet us at our table and deliver the food menu even though it wasn't crowded at the time. I ordered the Caesar wrap and my friend ordered the Camburger. Unfortunately, the waitress brought me out the wrong entree and a side dish that did not order. I ended up returning the side dish and the entire. The kitchen staff proceeded to make me a Caesar wrap like I ordered. In the end, I was still charged accidentally for the side dish that I didn't order but that was corrected on my bill. The restaurant was a bit colder which made it a bit uncomfortable. Also, my friend was not given the correct change for her bill. Overall, the food is fine and the service was below average.

photos.caption: Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

jYJlsmundDZYSJim9xOdDA.text: Half off entire menu Sundays, 8 till midnight, need I say more? Cool space, really clean and the food was very good. We ordered Rueben rolls, an all American burger and fancy turkey sandwich and enjoyed everything along with a few beers. Service was good even though our server was really busy. Will definitely be back!

MUmG0V_c-NlYG7L3zZa2HQ.text: New place dahn in the sahth sahd.   Great been selection and excellent "bar" type food.   Just opened so it doesn't seem very busy

n7VwqPHaa9jIK7_yKM0Avw.text: Great place to watch the game. Wonderful local atmosphere. Steeler Nation is in full effect.

Uo4JoxtKRDBLaP5b7uoEdA.text: Nice relaxing place.  Friendly staff.  My Greek salad was very fresh.  The daily special was half off sandwiches, I did not get one, they looked really good on other people's plates.

1Zm-_VLC6nNNphijT-n8vw.text: We ate here for the first time last night.  Good service, great food, and a really nice atmosphere!  We'll return for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Luau chicken wrap
Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Meatloaf sliders
Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fajita quesadilla

CrHO6oO7Yf7fLKYzlCzxTA.text: Great happy hour 5 to 7. Good list of brews and unique food. Good serve on top of that.

dr-WW_J4X99oaOkCoo3qGQ.text: I got the southern comfort (BBQ pork/Mac n cheese/other good stuff) I just wish there was more filling and less tortilla lol. It was tasty though. Good beer selection. Music isn't too loud, comfortable setting. I'd come back

3RtVpUo4OYwsrfu1pL8ihA.text: Definitely worth a stop by if you are in Pittsburgh. The burger was pretty good and while they don't have a large beer selection it's good for its size.

VXFoDgfJoClCNXdlbVJRMA.text: Super yummy my friends and I went here a few months ago super cute and nice atmosphere !!!!lits of different options for food which is fun !!!!

D3zxAaIT5vZC8ed8VfyETg.text: Visiting Pittsburgh on business. Wanted something different & delicious. The menu had a wide variety to satisfy me with diet restrictions & my associate who did not. I had the ahi which I ordered rare. It was fabulous! Best i've ever had hands down. My associate's burger looked awesome.  Would highly recommend.

EMw0DYo1JHhXezvWak7hew.text: Great bar, food really good. Just a nice place to sit and enjoy the beers,food and service. Classy exception to the fly by night bars on the Southside!!!'

toI3JqTVPFnXqAR1Vjeiuw.text: Found this gem while looking for a good happy hour spot and it's great! Very good happy hour, great wings. The bartender cut up cucumbers to make a cucumber mule because I'm "that" person but she was very nice, attentive and informative! New favorite happy hour place

zTq73x0N74gL0qUVMbTo7w.text: Great atmosphere and very clean. Had TVs throughout the bar so we were able to watch some football games while eating lunch. Our waiter was super friendly and provided great service. Food is reasonably priced and very good. Lots of options to choose from on the menu and both items we picked were delicious. Will definitely go back in the future to enjoy more food!

qAyAh553WveDzVOQLjibyQ.text: This was a great find! We stopped through here for lunch one day and it was perfect! I ordered the Buffalo Mac & Cheese and it was amazing! I was with a few other people and they all enjoyed their meals as well. The service was good as well. If we are ever in the area we would probably come back. Definitely a gem!

photos.caption: Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chocolate dessert
Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ruben Bowl
Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. BBQ Bowl

jULJXI0WKiocse-dBx9bcA.text: The food here was amazing and the prices were very fair. We came for brunch because they were open from 10am-3pm and we had a late start to our day. We went to the one in Southside, but there is a Lawrenceville and Wexford location as well. We ordered the donut holes as an appetizer, and it was only five dollars for probably 15 or 20 donut holes and 3 different sauces to choose from (cinnamon butter, chocolate, and strawberry sauce). I think we paid an extra 50 to try all three. The donut holes were warm and delicious. Then I had the morning cheesesteak made with a wrap instead of on bread. It was delicious, but there were too many fatty, chewy pieces of meat. However, it was still really good. It came with a choice of hash browns, fresh cut fries, or sweet potato tots. I chose sweet potato tots with no regret, but I do wish they were crunchy on the outside. The service was a bit slow even though it wasn't busy, but our waitress was kind. Overall, I had a great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Morning cheesesteak made with a wrap instead: shaved steak, scrambled egg, grilled onion, and criminology, beer cheese, chipotle mayo

6--HURthDEmIuJcPXGg0IA.text: Dive Bar was an unexpected finding for us. I ordered the Greek salad and my husband had a burger with sweet potato tots. I thought the sweet potato tots were delicious dipped into the cinnamon sugar icing. We also tried the nachos and fried pickles. Normally, I love every type of fried pickle. This time, I wasn't as impressed- the breading was delicious, but slid right off so I was eating the pickles separate from the breading. The queso sauce on the nachos was DELICIOUS. I could have eaten another serving of the nachos, rather than the pickles. I wish they would have had more vegetarian options and maybe a choice for soup. Aside from these few things, the service was wonderful, vibe was cool, and food was good. This is a great place to stop for a drink or quick lunch- I look forward to returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

nYT1TzsEGPyqh9CgyL0kJA.text: A really welcome addition to the neighborhood. My girlfriend and I have been here 10+ times since they have opened. We usually like to mix it up, but this place continues to impress.   Restaurants that have very diverse menus often fail becuase it is difficult to produce quality and quantity. Dive certainly bucks this trend. Almost everything on the menu is excellent. The only bad expierience I had was the wings (little soggy), but I am going to give them another chance. Everything else has been consistently great.   The drink selection here is optimal- plenty of draft options, and a large cocktail menu. Something for everyone. The ambiance is nice too- defintley something southside has been lacking.  Last but certainly not least- their happy hour specials are outrageous here. So worth it. Check this place out if you haven't yet, you won't be dissapointed.

_Ep28rJDhoE22hY_zAwWLw.text: Very yummy food and great craft beer and cocktail options! I brunched here for the first time yesterday and they did not disappoint!

oyysBkCty4IdwGCoEtyZnw.text: A surprising find on E Carson that I will return to again and again.  Excellent happy hour choices from food to drafts to cocktails.  Sandwiches were generous in portion size and everyone in our party agreed on freshness and taste.   Ambiance was a fresh look for south side, sound level allowed for conversation among 5 adults. Fun place!

photos.caption: Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shrimp p&#39;boy and sweet potato taters!

8q-m8KcwTFFCnP3i9OQfEw.text: I've been here several times on a Saturday and they ask for last call at midnight. The bar is supposed to be open until 2. As far as I can tell, it's mostly one bartender being lazy but this place is predictably disappointing.

otutprBR4hqd4JUx6jmntA.text: Great meal.  Ahi Tuna wrap was fantastic.  Friendly staff and great service.   Traveling on business I would definitely recommend this place for a casual meal in a relaxed atmosphere.

TouUrfPYdHSyMgbY45w3kg.text: Came in for an after dinner drink following mallorca just up the street. The old coppertops had 2 other patrons in the whole establishment, which the bartender said had now been dive bar for 6 months.. it wasn't hard to see why by the attitude and demeanor of the staff. The male bartender had a great personality and even agreed the other two employees were "admittedly having rough days".. the tall blondes awful attitude only paled in comparison to the glasses wearing brunette that flaunted her misery. When you work in the highest concentration of bars per  capita in the entire US, you have to stand out somehow. If it isn't by concept, it better be by service. Unfortunately this will be our last stop in.

mH-iHlP77r9YhPXoyM6DeQ.text: This place is great! My boyfriend and I always love to see and try new restaurants as they come in and out of our South Side neighborhood.  It's no secret that restaurants turn over pretty frequently, especially in this mid-section of Carson St.  Dive is in the old Coppertops space but they have completely remodeled with a great new atmosphere.  The service is great and the food is even better.  We've eaten here twice now and have not been disappointed either time.  This last visit I had the Shrimp Po Boy but subbed out the shrimp for crab cakes and made it a wrap instead of sandwich - it was incredible!! They've got something good going here..  I checked out their menu from their other locations online and I cannot WAIT until they begin serving Brunch at this location; the Brunch menu items sound phenomenal!

bVP-lXhq_oKkuo3-IJSr4Q.text: I'm almost hesitant to leave this review, because I want to keep this Dive location all to myself... but people need to know about it! I've actually never been to the other locations, but the service, food, and atmosphere of the Southside location are spot on.   My boyfriend lives right around the corner and this has become a go-to spot for us. The drink menu is extensive (really solid list of drafts, bottles, wines, and craft cocktails) and they have a good happy hour as well. The bartenders are always very friendly and every drink I've tried here has been delicious!  I've been in for brunch and dinner and I am honestly shocked at how huge their menu is. There is literally something for everyone. Pages and pages of apps, sandwiches, large plates, wraps, salads, bowls... you name it. Everything that we've tried has ranged to pretty good to excellent - we've never had a bad meal. We've even brought my parents here and my stepdad is quite the picky eater. He loved it!  The atmosphere is really great as well. With the place being fairly new it's never been packed anytime we've gone in. I could see it getting busier as the location becomes more popular! I am really glad that Dive has chosen to open a location in the Southside and will continue to go back.

7JPkrHTjlEExdpeNaZqlbg.text: came in here by chance because I wanted to hit the Thai restaurant down the street but it was closed.   What a stroke of luck because this place was great! I had the pretzel bread sticks with beer cheese as an appetizer. The pretzels were soft, warm, salty and the beer cheese was amazing.   I also had the thai beef salad and it had great flavor.   They had a great selection of local beers which I am always on the hunt for as an out of towner.   If I am in the area again, I will be back.

-De6qx2Ud2ptQDdJxKO25g.text: Great drinks. Great food. Great service. I've been here multiple times, each time ordering something different, and every meal was delicious. I also enjoyed their cocktail options...possibly too much lol.

2gBkR91RUXunWXBEy9qYkw.text: This has quickly become one of my favorite happy hour spots!!! 1/2 price appetizers and discounts on all specialty drinks!!! And there is A LOT to chose from. If you happen to miss happy hour, no worries, there is always a daily special!! I have been to both locations and they are consistent between both! I would recommend the Camburger! It's quite messy but so good and different!

c0dfS0FYbjg8ap8oztF63g.text: Giving Dive Bar & Grille (SS Location) 3 stars for now. I will definitely go back and check it out again to update my review.I know this business just recently opened, so I think with some time they will work their way up to a higher review. There was simply nothing that stood out at Dive Bar & Grille.   We went early Saturday evening (around 4-5 PM) for apps & drinks. The atmosphere inside is really nice & clean and it looks like they did a great job at renovating from what was there before (I believe it used to be Coppertops). There is also an upstairs but we sat downstairs by the window. There was only 1 other party eating there and a handful of people sitting at the bar while we were there. It was kind of a weird time, but hopefully they get busier throughout the night!  Chris and I both ordered beers from the draft list. If you like beer, they had a lot of good options! I went with my first Summer Shandy of the year, which you can never go wrong with. Chris explained to the waiter what he was looking to drink and he helped with picking one. Their menu is huge and has something for everyone! We ended up ordering just appetizers and split them between the 2 of us. We got the hummus plate, zucchini fries, and kalua pork sliders. Everything was good but nothing amazing. I look forward to going back and trying one of their entrees, everything sounded good!

IIWOqDcDM2IJNibbZWDX4g.text: I stumbled upon this place and found out that their Southside location just opened recently. The place is really hip and cozy and the staff is awesome! I came during happy hour and found their specials to be amazing - half off all appetizers and many drink specials as well. I ordered 4 different appetizers and every single one was delicious. I would definitely come back for happy hour and try some drinks as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ahi tuna bites
Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grilled bella appetizer
Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shrimp and grits

cFGSQ47FU7_dbmf5djpXpw.text: I've been here several times and have always enjoyed it. The prices are great, especially for happy hour! The food is also really really good. I would definitely recommend this place to all ages also.

YFsgCOUn3M0ulcpbetEb8g.text: Stopped in for a fun dinner, apps and drinks before a night out. Had the Mahi sandwich and southern comfort quesadilla. Was really good! Good beer selection and a menu with lots of variety, great place to go with a group.

Q-vkvF_XsDTbAqqJ7ArGuw.text: Ordered takeout. Food was average. Definitely not worth the money. Had wings, crab cake sliders, and steak sandwich. If you enjoy bland food you will enjoy this restaurant.

rHQb8PZgdbC2GPE2dpTuKg.text: Definitely overlooked this place! I was impressed at how good the food is! Pretty standard options: apps/burgers/sandwiches/wraps/salads but made well. I got the south of the border burger and the flavors we just delicious. Staff was friendly and helpful. Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. South of the border burger minus bun +side salad

xmMCNaA-ReG1ysQnno74jg.text: I went here again yesterday with my friend and got the camburger it was so good! I also got the pineapple beer that's brewed by river town I believe. The service was great once again but unfortunately I forgot my leftovers. I definitely want to come back and try other things on their menu since they have such diverse choices hopefully I won't forget my left overs next time!

6Mar88053LMBjMZJyj1oXw.text: You had me at "Saturday Brunch"  I had full intentions on getting tacos down the road, but the only thing better than tacos is brunch. Dive has a Saturday brunch til 3. I peaked at the menu on the window and decided to head on in.  I ordered a bloody Mary. It was a homemade mix. It was delicious. A little too peppery for me but overall not bad.  I waa stuck between western burrito (peppers onion eggs hashbrowns) or a breakfast cheese steak (shaved steak onions eggs peppers) i went with burrito and decided on French fries since burrito already has hash browns in it. Sadly I got hash browns instead of fries on the side but o well.  Overall great menu and cool vibe. Sat & Sunday happy hour 9-11. Kitchen open til midnight daily. Kids brunch menu (including deep fried pb&j)

photos.caption: Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Western burrito with hash browns
Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bloody mary

9O9QSRX26M9uoq7zj-itGA.text: Honestly I was not impressed.  First I am not a fan of the name. I know it's nitpicky but name a place "dive bar" and making it very corporate looking just irks me. But I gave it a try none the less.  It is loud! Even though everyone was just sitting at the tables talking to each other the design of the room makes it nearly impossible to hear the waitress. Or the people you came there with. Eventually we got tired of screaming "sorry I didn't catch that" and just ate in "silence".  I ended up with a burger and it was okay. Nothing special. Felt like I could walk anywhere on Carson and get the same burger for a cheaper price.  The one upside is their happy hour and draft list.

a1CniQDXuRx_e3YLTFe5Hw.text: Dive Bar is a great place to come for happy hour and for a chill place away from the chaos of South Side. We split a small plate and a large plate and that was more than enough for us, plus a couple of drinks! Service was great and the atmosphere is nice: not too loud, but still busy enough to not feel dead.   The pretzel sticks are bomb, plus very nicely-priced. I would get these again on my next visit here. We also got the stacked mac and cheese, which comes with buffalo chicken tenders on top. Wasn't a huge fan of the added chicken because it was slightly dry and there were only a few pieces - I would probably get the regular mac and cheese next time I came.   Overall, it's a great place to grab drinks and food on a chill night out! I will definitely come back to try out their brunch menu, as it looked pretty good and decently-priced!

uDXqwuDOBZ2utcz6IxAxeA.text: April 7, 2018  Waited way too long to post this, but at least I got around to it. My letter to Dive Bar and the reason I've never returned to this shit April 7, 2018  Dive Bar & Grille Attn:  Tom (owner) 2132 E Carson St Pittsburgh, PA 15203  Tom:  Enclosed, please find a money order for $50 to pay for food I did not order.  This closes the matter between you and I.  Considering the situation, as a wise business owner, you'd be remiss if you didn't take a moment to think about the experience from your former customer's point of view.  Wouldn't you want to know what caused two customers who have patronized your business multiple times to get up and walk out?  From my perspective, you delivered food we did not order.  We asked if we could have a mix of the varieties of tacos and your server said yes. I confirm we did order one of every variety, but your staff was well aware of what they were doing - taking advantage of customers.  I'm sure they were laughing in the back when they put in the order for 15 tacos.  Your server should have had enough common sense to confirm we wanted 15 tacos when I specifically asked if the tacos could be mixed and matched on a plate and then said we wanted 5 tacos, not plates.  When I approached the server after the ridiculousness was delivered, I got nothing but attitude with the summary message you ordered wrong, so too bad.  Then you sent, what I assume was your bartender (as you implied on our call yesterday), to take a picture of my license plate.  This is another thing you should think about.  What if your employee had been injured?  You showed absolutely no regard for your employee's health and safety by sending him/her out into heavy traffic to sneak behind a running vehicle wearing all black at night.  Furthermore, I'd suggest whomever blindly followed your orders should take some time to reflect upon themselves and determine why they're willing to risk themselves for a $50 tab and an owner who doesn't care about his employees.  Last of all, you blackmailed me with your surveillance video to get what you want, $50.  Well, now you have it and everything else that comes with it.  Had you looked at things from my perspective, you could have worked with me to come to an amenable agreement as I'd requested on the phone; however, you chose to create an enemy.  You make poor business decisions and if you continue to do so, your business will suffer.    Now that I've provided all this useful constructive criticism, you can choose to act on it or not.  Either way, not only have you stolen from me and blackmailed me, I've given you advice that will help your business in the future should you choose to heed it.  You're welcome, B

HZQamM_LhOXCtuZoxmgHXg.text: Love love love Dive Bar! I've been here plenty of times and I love their food! They have a great menu with many options. I'm so glad they came to South Side! This is one of the better restaurants to eat at in the area. Great portions and reasonable prices. I love their menu because it's not traditional bar food. The ahi tuna wrap is amazing, one of my favs. I also love the chopped chicken salad, it's my go to. The buffalo egg rolls...I mean how can one not love creamy buffalo chicken fried in a crispy wrap! I've also been for brunch and love the build your own bowls. My boyfriend says their burgers are great. I've had private parties upstairs for work and they always do a fantastic job with the catering. The service is always good too. I've honestly never had a bad experience here. They have great happy hour specials and also daily specials. The $5 tacos on Thursdays are delicious and filling. Sunday's is their best special yet...from 8-11 the whole menu is half off!! You can't go wrong with Dive Bar! This place is doing everything right.

photos.caption: Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. $5 pork tacos
Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chopped chicken salad

xaMsuEvzgBUyt93tytYw8g.text: LET me tell you something about this place.... they have good food.   They had half off appetizers when I  arrived so I decided to take advantage of them.... I MEAN their special.....  and order 3 items. They were all DELICIOUS. This was some of the best made food I've had yet. Everything was spot on.  I had the ahi tuna, best I've had yet. I had the Grilled Bella mushrooms on garlic bread... delicious  I had the pretzel sticks with cinnamon butter. Yummy.  Definitely want to come back for dinner and their weekend brunch. A must try.

photos.caption: Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Southern comfort
Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pretzel bread with cinnamon butter
Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

yABAkqfGFOuBNtbSxJTVVA.text: Just went here for the Father's Day brunch and it was delicious. Everyone got something different and everything looked great and everyone was happy! I got the farmers market omelette and it was so yummy! The veggies were all really fresh and it was stuffed with them! No skimping here! My boyfriend got the chorizo and hash bowl which was very large and looked great. The breakfast burritos and breakfast burgers my boyfriend dad and sisters got also looked yummy. The waitress was really friendly and attentive and brought us over a complimentary funnel cake for Father's Day! She gave us the options of chocolate chips, bananas, or berries. It was huge, enough for all of us to share! Will definitely be back to try more menu items at some point!

6r4ub2pnqIEaUc4iAFdXKg.text: Food was absolutely amazing and service was even better!!!! We went for brunch and ordered steak and eggs as well as the chicken and funnel cake. This was one of the best brunches I have ever had. The mimosas were also amazing and appetizers were great. Our server Malcom exceeded expectations and was very attentive but not overbearing. Overall if I ever visit Pittsburg again, this will be my go to place!

VaDKgLnNd2tz3mySzuyjnA.text: Awesome happy hour. Maybe the best deal I've found in Pittsburgh so far. Select items are HALF OFF like wings and some bomb quesadillas. Servers here were super cool and the beer list was good too with a lot of local brews. I had an order of wings which were tasty, my date had shrimp and grits, and we also split a quesadilla that had pulled pork and Mac and cheese in it. Each of us got a drink and my bill was only 24 bucks. Unheard of. Will be back very soon to try more happy hour items!

photos.caption: Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

wk0IpqdCSWNZp3F7JTCn6Q.text: I love the Dive bar and Grille! Always exceptional service and food. I'm a regular here and am always made to feel welcomed every single time I walk in. Tom and Denny know me by name and always ask me how I'm doing. Definitely highly recommended. Excellent cocktails. Always rotating beer selection, and we can't forget about the amazing daily specials.  Mon - 1/2 price burgers Tue - 1/2 price sandwiches and wraps Wed - 1/2 price wings Thurs - Tacos  If you are in the Southside check this place out, you won't regret it!

ICZx9H9F23y53EGNWSxGOA.text: So impressed with this place. Great service and excellent food and beer selection. We really enjoyed our seared ahi tuna and fish & chips. The tuna was rare, just as I requested.

I9PVi4mS76zijnAI0XhHdA.text: After a long Wednesday my buddy and I decided to grab a brew at Dive, it being my first time coming in I wasn't exactly sure what to expect. Upon walking in I noticed the Long fireplace along the back of the room and the beautiful bar top. The selection of  beers was quite plentiful and the bartenders were also quite attentive. Definitely a satisfied patron!

vWti0Ez4O-g6hw83p2dVVA.text: A new(er) southside spot is a nice addition. There is a great selection on the menu and the happy hour prices are amazing! There are a variety of apps on the menu, and they are half priced during their happy hour to compliment a drink of the day and reduced wine / beer prices.  The staff has been very friendly each time I've been there and very knowledgeable about the menu. I'm always happy when I ask about the beer selection and they offer a sample if it's something new - certainly helped me find a good one!  The chicken wings are pently for a full meal for me. I had the regular ones with all different sauces for dipping, because I couldn't choose just one. The spicier the better for me, so I went with the sriracha / spicy / garlic flavored ones. Delish!

Jki_bD9i9iDMLrExsO6g_g.text: Nice late night and hits the spot. I've been through the week. Has multiple option to choose from and great specials during the week day.  Staff very friendly.  I really enjoyed the tacos. Flavorful, different and variety. My favorite was the Mediterranean Wrap. So flavorful. Definitely recommend.

vFjiHUkLYMgQd1wMqAN9bQ.text: I love this place. Food is always fantastic. Daily specials make it extremely affordable. Drinks are very good.

XmUKyBDN_JuIjuD08vuWRw.text: Love this place! It's a must go on Tuesdays in particular. Half price sandwiches and $5 margs. I got the Turkey Gouda Melt sandwich as a wrap. I'm telling you this wrap with a margarita is the best combo. Great service, great draft list, great atmosphere, great food, all at an amazing price! Can't get enough of this place. See you there next Tuesday

photos.caption: Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

o2yvGnxSa7BIpIzKjO_Gmw.text: Literally the worst customer service experience ever.  Not one staff member..... the 2 miserable severs or the miserable bartender smiled the entire time.   They belong in a US Government job and not customer service.  If they worked for the government then  they wouldn't have to work the 4th and maybe they would be kinder.  For working in a customer service/tipped position I'm not sure how they make any money.  They literally were so miserable. Totally never returning to this place based on these 3 individuals alone. Spend your money elsewhere and deal with friendly people and to the miserable people working.... get a job somewhere else.

MwJMp7oXO-9yERX1JFYeqw.text: My son, Luke and my nephew,Derek, treated my sister Sylvia, my nephew's girlfriend Tiffany,and myself to a FABULOUS late night dinner at this awesome restaurant! Yummy yummy yummy     It was my first time here and I enjoyed it  very much !!! The server were great and very friendly! I hope to go there again!

photos.caption: Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. My Stuffed Croquettes and mac&amp;cheese

WOh19wXvXOVnBImqaGBOkQ.text: I was kind of excited to come here since I've never been. Have to be honest and say it was our 4-5th place to go because everything closed at 10 on this particular evening.  Went in nice place, looked like a good menu, beers were good.  Now the service and food a totally different story!  Meals came out before the silverware and napkins...even after asking at least 3 times. Wasn't busy so shouldn't have been any confusion. Couldn't get a water if you were on fire, asked twice and had to go to bar since server forgot. Asked for sliders extra well done - came out as a chopped up patty (not sliders) medium well. Didn't eat them..server never asked if things were ok. Kept disappearing to who knows where.  French fries were decent, wings seemed ok (friends got them). But had to ask for sauce 2-3 times.   Missing the mark here on service mostly. Food not worth the lack in service.

photos.caption: Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. One hamburger cut in 4 pieces and called sliders - asked extra extra well done- um no it wasn&#39;t.
Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fries- prob need to change the grease more often but not horrible.

t6JKHr0Jl6Aydu78hpd1_g.text: First time here and I must say I really enjoyed this spot ! I had a couple of the fatheads beers, as well as the ahi tuna bites and Panko shrimp - all delicious ! There were so many other items on the menu that looked so good , I can't wait to come back and try them out . It was a Thursday night and they were pretty busy. Our waitress was super nice and attentive , she held down her busy section pretty well.  My friend and I had a high top table beside the bar, and though it was super small , it was sufficient enough for some app plates and a couple of glasses.  I plan on coming back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Apps!

3TJzp2t0TrdmmSWhhL1ecg.text: This place was super cool and chill! They helped us out a lot and was super attentive to our 11 party table. The Thai wrap was sooooo good with the peanut sauce and the bbq short rib sandwich was so so so yummy. My favorite part was the home made brownie with ice cream on top. Thank goodness i was able to share my food and eat a little bit of everything.

DAEEgJ6nmm_XJcmG8vNT3g.text: My wife and I visited the Southside location yesterday for dinner.the service was superb our waitress was fantastic in the crusted shrimp was delicious however, we ordered the crab cakes with the rizzuto and the crab cakes were undercooked tasted fishy and left a nasty aftertaste my mouth.I also bit into a shell that was in the crab cakes and after that I was just pissed off. it was too late to complain but I guess If I go back there  I'll order something else but for 53 bucks that's why I was pissed off. The two stars is definitely for the waitress and the service

q9Txvw8OyNYxSzdLCqcnow.text: I ordered delivery on a Sunday night. The food came earlier than predicted which is always a good thing.  I got the bar wings with Honey Sriracha sauce, fries, and asian slaw. It was $11.50 for 10 wings, which is decent, and I read the happy hour price is even better. There wasn't that much sauce, and the wings weren't well-coated. It felt like the wings were placed in the box, sauce dumped on top, and the delivery guy was in charge of getting the sauce distributed during delivery. The fries were mainly just a bunch of edge slivers containing skin. The slaw was pretty heavy, and almost a little too greasy for my taste. However, the cabbage/carrots were fresh.   I saw a trend with in-restaurant meal reviews being yummier, so this place is probably not the best for delivery. I'd definitely give this place a try in-person next time during a happy hour.

iTa1GU3n__Nj-dLVglFO7g.text: I came to Dive on the Wednesday before thanksgiving with a group of coworkers. We got out early so it wasn't exactly happy hour yet but there were specials on wine and wings! The wings I got were great. I can't remember exactly what flavor but the people in my group that got dry rubbed didn't like there's. Mine were a sauce and were perfect!    I'd definitely stop by again. It was a cute little spot. Big menu. We were all able to find street parking.

vqm9ifvG1fcBRnK8rjBxvQ.text: My friend and I stopped here for a Saturday brunch on our way to get a massage. Really nice experience. They have a great brunch menu- Bloody Mary was bold and spicy. I had the Morning After which is basically eggs meat toast and hash browns. I had chorizo and eggs over easy- both were perfect. No bread variety only Texas toast. Hash browns were OK. My friend has the funnel pancakes.  Now THEY were really good- brunch versio of a country fair. Will go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Morning after- eggs over easy and chorizo
Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Funnel pancake
Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bloody mary

t5ZG1X0VtKUsjoh1ua3FFw.text: YUM!!  I've come here a few times and always order something different. There are so many options it's hard to go wrong.   Today I went in for a quick bite on my lunch break. It was pretty desolate but I didn't mind having the place basically to myself. I ordered the mahi sandwich with fries. The pineapple and chipotle sauce were perfect.   I've also come for happy hour which is a great deal on apps! You can easily make a yummy early meal that way.   Can't wait to come back and try something else!

fBUy9mMOMVHYemRfwusO7A.text: Great food cool vibe the Dive Bar and Grille was the perfect Sunday brunch choice for this family of 4 on our food road trip that started Thursday.  Our 4th food stop found us at Dive shortly after church today.  Thankfully the menu seemed to offer something for everyone.  My youngest had the crab/ eggs Benedict, our oldest got the Salmon BLT wrap and my wife and I shared the Pittsburgh Cheese steak (Pittsburgh beer cheese sauce).  Absolutely perfect bar food.  After 3 days of world cuisine we were all ready to go our own way.  Each dish was perfectly portioned and had just enough of a twist to make it unique to the Dive experience.  The atmosphere was perfectly laid back (matching the vibe of the closed street for families biking/ walking dogs/ and an outdoor spin class) and staff seemed to be having fun.  Based on the menu and comfortable atmosphere this was no Dive bar although I'm pretty sure I could have gotten a PBR if I hadn't been tempted by the Nitro option on tap.   Dive is a Pittsburgh must for anyone looking for a tasty food variety and a great beer and liquor selection.

BrZSbwfSJoHlWlyNTWXqcQ.text: Stopped in on a Thursday with my cousin who had never been here and I think I converted him to a Fan.    I ordered the Hangover which was Prosciutto, bacon, provolone, lettuce, tomato, pesto aioli and a fried egg on top.  It came out on toasted, thin cut bread and looked delicious.  It was a tad hard to eat as the bread didn't hold up well once the sandwich was fully assembled but the taste was delicious.  The home made potato chips were a perfect side.    My cousin ordered the Alabama Slammer burger which had a brown sugar glaze, bacon, cheddar, provolone topped with onion straws.  He ordered the fries and a side of slaw.  Judging from the fact that he didn't say a single word till that burger was fully engulfed in his digestive cavity, I would say he loved it.    This is my 5th or 6th visit to this location and everything we have ever ordered has been delicious.  Skip the busy section of Carson St and find this gem for Happy Hour- the specials are awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Alabama Slammer burger
Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Hangover sandwich
Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cuban Sandwich is worthy of a &#39;Castro Salute&#39;...!!!

a4geIjExT5xOntq4faT2hA.text: Happy Hour Review: This is a great place for HH. Solid app options and cocktail for a great deal. My friend and I met up here after work. We split three apps (all of which are half price). We had the southern comfort (quesadilla with pulled pork and mac and cheese), spinach dip and panko shrimp. Very random selections but all of which were solid.   My friend opted for a beer and I went for a scotch cocktail (just one of those days). They were both $2 off.   The waitress was very on top of everything, even with it being pretty busy since the Steelers were playing.   This place is a great call for HH, but not sure I can speak to any other time of the day.

k3pX6xXDZirWlP0B1hG2vA.text: Dive bar is such an awesome little spot!  My boyfriend and I came for happy hour during the week and it was wonderful!  Dive Bar's happy hour is M-F 5-7 and S-S 9-11 and consists of 1/2 off apps and great cocktail/beer/wine specials!  In addition to the happy hour specials Dive Bar has weekly specials too, we happened to be there on 1/2 price sandwich night!  I swear between the apps and the sandwiches we could pick from almost the entire menu at 1/2 off!  We ended up choosing fried pickles, loaded croquettes, quesadilla, and the turkey Cobb sandwich with sweet potato tots.  Everything was sooo yummy! I have to say the sweet potato tots were addicting and served with a cinnamon butter that I couldn't get enough of!  I can't wait to go back and try some more happy hour apps!

photos.caption: Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried pickles
Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken quesadilla
Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Loaded Croquettes! Basically pulled pork on a potato pancake...delish!

aRsGw5QIWLww_a0-H-qzBw.text: Dive is a great go to for food. They always have awesome specials, the food is great, and they have a great drink selection. I've been to a couple of their locations and they all are consistently great!

4yR-7kdq7RfpmJBDCfLZyw.text: Actually not a dive bar at all! Clean & cool place for brunch, lunch or dinner. Everything ordered was very good including drinks , apps & meals. Friendly fast service. Definitely will be going back!!

nlXDZxz-uwKbAfzvLkUanA.text: My friends and I met here around 6 PM during the week. We were seated right away in a booth in the back. My friend and I were looking to get an appetizer and settled on the Pittsburgh Nachos. This plate was their house chips piled high with beer cheese, bacon and other fabulous nacho toppings! It did not disappoint. For my meal, I had the Luau Chicken wrap! It was chicken and bacon, topped with pineapple salsa, red bell pepper, spring mix, onion and bbq sauce. It was both salty and sweet! My other friends got variations of the buffalo chicken sandwich. One friend asked for it to be in a wrap and the other asked for it to be between to pieces sourdough bread and pressed like a panini. The waitress was extremely accommodating and got my friends exactly what they want! I will definitely be back to try other dishes off their menu!

bmfSRdle7YKzfoNBA5zAxg.text: I've been to dive bar a few times for happy hour but never tried the food.  It's a nice atmosphere with a decent beer selection, but can feel a bit cramped with a lot of people.

z6HkE0I94_v4JJI_BJpZYw.text: The waitress told us she thought we would like the bacon wrapped dates when she heard us debating them.... she was right!

QhKAmB--gLPMEbw_sVhU0g.text: Came in for drinks. Good amount of draft selections (~24) Pretty decent sized TVs for the hockey/football games.  Good service. Was also very clean and well put together in terms of design. Bathrooms were clean as well -- always a plus in the southside.

3wp-TBQPCllelAjL3JqwvA.text: Parking can be found on the street or in lots. I think the meters run til 6pm.  We went for happy hour and it was delicious. I got the dirty martinis which were $2 off and they were so delightfully dirty and delicious. They came with bleu cheese stuffed olives.  We split some apps since all of the Small Bites section was half off. Everything came out fairly quickly considering it was happy hour and getting busy.  The Southern Comfort quesadilla was so good! It was filled with smoked Gouda, house mac n cheese and pulled pork. The fried crimini mushrooms came out in a giant basket filled to the brim. They were lightly coated in flour and fried. The side of horseradish sauce for dipping was key. The fried pickles were giant pickle spears again lightly floured and fried and paired with their homemade ranch.  Can't wait to go back and try some more of the amazing sounding food!

photos.caption: Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried pickles
Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Southern comfort quesadilla
Photo of Dive Bar and Grille - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried crimini mushrooms with horseradish sauce
